info.p: "The OpenDocument Text Document Format (ODT) (...) is a format for editable textual documents. It is one of several subtypes in the ODF family for particular content categories. Designed to be a native format for word-processing applications, the format is sometimes called ODT after its usual file extension." (after LoC)

The primary locus of maintenance and development of the standard behind the ODF family is the OASIS Open ODF Technical Committee. The ISO variant of the standard is dated for 2015 and corresponds to version 1.2 of the format (while the current development version in 2025 is version 1.4).

Since version 1.4 is not yet attested in format registries, and version 1.2 is the one standardised with ISO, we provide external IDs for versions 1.2 and 1.3 (the latter approved as an OASIS Standard in April 2021.

The SIS does not offer ODT descriptions of higher granularity, i.e. no separate descriptions for ODT 1.3, etc. If a centre needs to make a distinction between development versions, the <comment> field has to be used for that purpose.
